message_1:
A cryptographic hash function takes an input message of any length and produces an output message of fixed length. Let's assume that the hash function H(x) is a 256-bit hash function. 

The input message is "Cryptography is awesome". What will be the output message (in hexadecimal format) after applying the hash function H(x)?
message_2:
As an AI, I cannot compute the hash function directly. However, I can guide you on how to do it using a programming language or a tool.

For example, you can use the SHA-256 hash function in Python to compute the hash of the input message:

```python
import hashlib

input_message = "Cryptography is awesome"
hash_object = hashlib.sha256(input_message.encode())
hash_hex = hash_object.hexdigest()

print(hash_hex)
```

Running this code will give you the output message in hexadecimal format. Note that the specific hash function used (SHA-256 in this case) will affect the output, so if you use a different 256-bit hash function, the result may be different.
